meanings.definition: A wig, especially one worn by men in the 17th and 18th centuries.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the actor wore a periwig to portray a historical character.
meanings.sent2: During the costume party, he put on a periwig to complete his outfit.
meanings.sent3: The periwig on the mannequin looked so old-fashioned, it made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her elaborate periwig was like a crown of hair, adding grandeur to her appearance.
meanings.sent5: The judge's periwig was so large and curly, it seemed to have a life of its own.

meanings.sent1: He decided to periwig for the event to match the historical theme.
meanings.sent2: She periwigged for the play, transforming into a character from the past.
meanings.sent3: When he periwigged for the party, his friends couldn't recognize him at first.
meanings.sent4: She periwigged herself with confidence, embracing the character she was portraying.
meanings.sent5: The actor periwigged skillfully, making the wig look natural and fitting for the era.
